body: Hi Riccardo, 1. The interior window is there. You just haven't connected it to preview component. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/3FLLVGZOVWK22lHVJRT2AwVYhbXoZpZ**2RReaahkT2qmvMcdrgVUrnSrJgRMBWge*jOkqvvj5Ke-3lRFwvZXjyjxY0Rr-E1/iw.png) 2. In energyplus shadings doesn't accept materials. You can use blinds instead. Take a look at "Honeybee_EnergyPlus Window Shade Generator" component. 3. SolveAdj component has the input to set BC for interior surfaces. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/3FLLVGZOVWIcfkq6ON39SZbv2IAtYduS*sB39xZjcmIi9qkshfutij6PNQo-hiYsLa6NcIM*ZFFn1EM4pCqK5YMPRXbR1oLx/S.png) If you want to set them to adiabatic then you can use setToAdiabatic components. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/3FLLVGZOVWK7wbhBuJ3o7KaAWuaN5SgnPglaHWQfarRNHU9WAg*025p3IXsHsisXwMy*q4Ari9hHOgwrKaJ7lK6Nx3h9RZ98/adiabatic.png) 4. For natural ventilation Chris has provided extensive answers [including this one](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/interzone-airflow-rate-for-a-large-volume?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1360388&groupId=2985220%3AGroup%3A658987). If the component doesn't work then you need to download the files manually from github and replace the userObjects with the old ones. You have to do it separately for Ladybug and Honeybee which can be painful. Is there anyway to change the firewall settings? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/3FLLVGZOVWJ0PRSjRj2Gl-scPlyX-QnoqCNncnBTL38YV9J7ZeE6HfmOxAraqd5XU7qdUqkDXf5NeQorkWjd-Jo3OO14Tag6/download.PNG)
